bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, July 13, 1940

div1.p: Kean lists various Senate documents dealing with the yellow fever investigation. He offers his opinion on the role of Lambert.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, July 13, 1940

opener.dateline:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
GEORGETOWN
WASHINGTON, D. C.
July 13, 1940-

div1.p:
You are very consciencious and
prompt in returning the papers which
came today. I was somewhat puz-
zled at your question written in
longhand at the end of the latter
about the article written in 1903
entitled “The scientific work & Discov-
eries of the late Major Walter Reed”
I certainly did not write a book
about him, Tho. I furnished, first
and last, quite a lot of material
for Kelly's fine book - It evidently
refer to some article which I pre-
pared. On looking into the compilation
“Yellow Fever” printed as Senate Document
c
K
2.
No. 822, of which you have a copy, I see
a footnote on page 48- I see that such was
the title of Senate Doc. No 118, Jan 28, 1903-
So I think that Chapter 6, pages 48 to
52 is Sen. Doc. No. 118- and that it was
furnished as a memorandum probably
to Senator Martin of Va- in our efforts
to get a pension for Mrs. Reed and
he had it printed- Then when I
was making the compilation “Yellow
Fever Sen. Doc. 822” I put it in as
Chapter 6 of the Part I. Of part I I wrote
Chaps 2. 3, the Memo signed by Surgeon Gen. OReilly-
4. The letter to Senator Owen signed by Surg. Gen. Tormy
and Chap. 6.

Of Chap. 5 I only contributed the pages 38, 39, 40
to which my name is attached-
Part II contains the publications of the Commission
Part III " Carroll's papers
Parts IV & V have the names of their authors attached

So you see you have the article you ask for-
3.
I was indignant to hear from the Surgeon
generals office since my last letter
that the House Military Committee has voted to
add the name of another Claimat to
the Yellow Fever Roll of Honor. His name
is Gustav E. Lambert formerly of the Army
Hospital Corps. He cared for yellow fever
patients as did dozens of other men and
women in Cuba, but had no connection
with the demonstration by the Reed Com-
mission of the cause of Yellow Fever-
Cannot you doctors of the Mayo Clinic
do something to stop this outrage on the
memory of Walter Reed and his group.
It is not quite as rank a scandal as
the Poucher proposition but it is bad
enough to cheapen the whole thing-

If these Congressmen want to do
do something for their constituents why
dont they do it honestly instead of
under false pretenses by attaching
these names to Reed's group and filtch
ing from it honors which do not belong
to them? Minnesota has a Senator on
the Senate Military Affairs Committee
Senator Ernest Lundeeu- If he were
informed of the dishonesty of this pro-
cedure he could probably head it
off in both cases-

I have found a nice letter of Walter
Reeds which I am glad to give to such
an appreciative admirer of his-

When I get your questions I will see
about the amount of writing and let
you know about the walter of a stenog-
rapher-
